page.title: 07LIFE STYLES
page.content: The children from North Kessock and Charleston go to Drumsittal School. There are nine children in P.7.Eight of those have parents who use their cars to go to Inverness to work and to shop in the supermarkets. Between the villages and the school runs the A.9.a very busy dual carriageway,with an underpass for the schoolchildren and for cattle.The children are safer on the school bus. On Sundays they go cycling and watch T.V.Three go to Sunday School and four to church.Family dinner is chicken or roast beef.Some visit relatives in Inverness.Sunday night is bath night. Children like singing and playing instruments.In May they played in "The Snow Queen"in Eden Court Theatre.In June the school won six awards in the Dingwall Music Festival.Only one child lives on a farm.
